comments.comment: SHUT UP Ashen you intentionally insulted ALL Buddhist monks & now don‚Äôt try to deny.  Why condemn 90% of monks when only 2-4% are pedophiles as in ALL other religions?  Do you know that unfortunately many Catholic Churches had to be closed and sold due to declining congestions ?  Some had to make payments to victims of sexual abuse by court orders and could not survive. Just like Thotawatta said the majority of Buddhist monks  in poor rural areas live frugal lives. You have only seen the so called 2% of monks in affluent cities where you your self live and associate. They too do not live luxurious lives compared to the politicians of Sri Lanka who have luxury vehicles and people waiting on them at beck and call.  The general public pushed away to make way for them when they travel! You and Ranjan are willfully instigating religious conflict and hatred in Sri Lanka that has to be prevented for peace and harmony.
comments.author: sam murphy

comments.comment:
Continuing 
Cheevara dharin means nothing but those who wear Buddhist robes ie monks. People in Sri Lanka respect this robe too not just those who wear it. Majority of monks live a simple life in poor villages in small temples with no income to repair their temples and receive breakfast and lunch only  if any villagers visit them with whatever vegetables and yams or rice they produce from a small plot of land they own. Ranjan and Ashen who are rich and  live in luxury themselves have acquainted only with a few Buddhist monks in the city who are a small percentage of all cheevara dharin. They get valuable donations from city dwellers so the two of them think that  all Buddhist monks live in luxury which is a false assumption stated in the video as an accusation against Buddhist monks. This definitely appears to be a preplanned rehearsed video if you see the instant inaccurate response by Ashen to Ranjan‚Äôs first question to accuse ‚Äúthose who wear Buddhist robes‚Äù instead of a more appropriate answer like ‚Äúpoliticians ‚Äú
comments.author: sam murphy
